radiographic_examinations.findings: Right basal effusion along with atelectasis. Atelectasis is also present at the left lung base. Stable tiny hypervascular focus in the right lobe of the liver. Enlarged spleen measuring 19 cm craniocaudally, no focal splenic lesions. Stable thickening of the adrenal glands. Stent present in the common bile duct, no intrahepatic biliary dilatation. Inflammatory changes in the peripancreatic mesentery in keeping with status post ERCP. Small amount of free fluid in the upper abdomen, likely related to recent ERCP. Mild colonic diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis. Ventral abdominal hernia containing mesenteric fat.
